issue.title: Handling errors

comment.body: There is some ability to track errors via the [Error State](https://amplitude.github.io/redux-query/docs/error-state) this would require you to add this to your redux store

commits.message: Add support for capturing requests and responses for test data generation

Merge pull request #341 from amplitude/kwallach/msw-add-on

Add support for capturing requests and responses for test data generation

pull_request.title: Add support for capturing requests and responses for test data generation
pull_request.body:
This PR adds support for capturing requests and responses made through redux-query, for use as test data. The capturing will only occur if the cookie `amp_store_requests_for_test_data` is set to `true`. If that cookie is enabled, two functions are made available on the window:
`getRequestsForTestData` - returns the object including rest and gql requests and their responses
`clearRequestsForTestData` - resets the request object to be empty, in case the user wants to isolate request capturing to one area of the app.

Loom explanation of the bigger picture: https://www.loom.com/share/c20ca7a364244578bb742d687469a1d5

repo.name: redux-query

comment.body: given this is a public package on NPM, do you think there is value in adding this in a configurable way? perhaps more broadly scoped cookie name at the very least?
